results.name: Denominator of n!!/(n+1)!! (cf. A006882).
comment: Also numerator of rational part of Haar measure on Grassmannian space G(n,1).
Also rational part of numerator of GAMMA(n/2+1)/GAMMA(n/2+1/2) (cf. A036039).
Let x(m) = x(m-2) + 1/x(m-1) for m >= 3, with x(1)=x(2)=1. Then the numerator of

x(n+2) equals the denominator of n!!/(n+1)!! for n >= 0, where the double factorials are given by A006882. - Joseph E. Cooper III (easonrevant(AT)gmail.com), Nov 07 2010, as corrected in Cooper (2015).
reference: D. A. Klain and G.-C. Rota, Introduction to Geometric Probability, Cambridge, p. 67.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..302
Joseph E. Cooper III, A recurrence for an expression involving double factorials, arXiv:1510.00399 [math.CO], 2015.
Svante Janson, On the traveling fly problem, Graph Theory Notes of New York Vol. XXXI, 17, 1996.
maple: if n mod 2 = 0 then k := n/2; 2*k*Pi*binomial(2*k-1,k)/4^k else k := (n-1)/2; 4^k/binomial(2*k,k); fi;
